hypothesis_content.title: SOL Momentum Continuation on High Relative Volume Spike
hypothesis_content.statement: If SOL's 1-hour volume exceeds its 20-hour moving average by >250% while price is up 2-5% in that same hour during a BULL regime, entering long on a retracement to the VWAP of that high-volume hour will capture continuation momentum over the next 6-8 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extreme volume spikes with moderate price appreciation in bull markets often signify strong accumulation or the start of a momentum move, not exhaustion. A retracement to VWAP provides a favorable risk/reward entry into that established flow. SOL's high beta makes it particularly responsive to such signals.
entry_conditions: Enter long on pullback to the 1-hour VWAP of the high-volume candle (within 2 hours)

exit_conditions.take_profit: +4% from entry OR 8 hours, whichever comes first
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Close below the low of the high-volume candle

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price fails to exceed the high of the signal candle within 8 hours in >40% of cases, or median return is negative.
